titleStmt.title: A breefe aunswer made vnto two seditious pamphlets, the one printed in French, and the other in English Contayning a defence of Edmund Campion and his complices, their moste horrible and vnnaturall treasons, against her Maiestie and the realme. By A.M.
titleStmt.author: Munday, Anthony, 1553-1633.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Iohn Charlewood, dwelling in Barbican, at the signe of the halfe Eagle and Key,

notesStmt.note: The pamphlets referred to were the anonymous "L'histoire de la mort que le R.P. Edmond Campion .. & autres ont souffert en Angleterre", and "A true reporte of the death & martyrdome of M. Campion Jesuite and preiste, & M. Sherwin, & M. Bryan priestes, at Tiborne the first of December 1581" by Thomas Alfield.
The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A.1."; the last leaf is blank.
Running title reads: An aunswer to a trayterous libell.
A variant of the edition with "Imprinted .. for Edward White" in imprint.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: Barbican, at the signe of the halfe Eagle
